a11rallypong

Class base

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • a11rallypong.base
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ball, paddle

    public abstract class base
extends java.lang.Thread
    The base class is an abstract class that holds the essential methods and values to be inherited by the ball and paddle classes.
    Author:
    Erich

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

      base(int x, int y, int screenH, int screenW)
      The base constructor takes in four values to setup the items on the screen in their designated spots.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void bounceOnX()
      An abstract method which is called when the object is to reverse its x velocity.
      abstract void bounceOnY()
      An abstract method which is called when the object is to reverse its y velocity.
      java.lang.Boolean collisionCheck(base o2)
      The collisionCheck method compares the locations of the ball (this) and the paddle (o2) and returns true if they have collided.

      The deflect method applies a 'spin' on the ball relative to how far from the center of the paddle the ball hit.

      The GameOver method is called once the while loop in the run method is finished (aka when the game is over).

      The getHitcount method is a getter that returns the current hitcount of the object.

      A function that sees if collisionCheck is true and calls the deflect and bounce methods if it is true.

    • Constructor Detail

      • base

        public base(int x,
            int y,
            int screenH,
            int screenW)
        The base constructor takes in four values to setup the items on the screen in their designated spots.
        Parameters:
        x - the desired initial position of the object on the x axis.
        y - the desired initial position of the object on the y axis.
        screenH - the height of the screen the object is being displayed on.
        screenW - the width of the screen the object is being displayed on.

    • Method Detail

      • getHitcount

        public int getHitcount()
        The getHitcount method is a getter that returns the current hitcount of the object.
        Returns:
        a count of hits made.

      • move

        public void move()
        The move method is in charge of moving the object by its x and y velocities

      • bounceOnY

        public abstract void bounceOnY()
        An abstract method which is called when the object is to reverse its y velocity.

      • bounceOnX

        public abstract void bounceOnX()
        An abstract method which is called when the object is to reverse its x velocity.

      • deflect

        public void deflect(base o2)
        The deflect method applies a 'spin' on the ball relative to how far from the center of the paddle the ball hit.
        Parameters:
        o2 - The object representing the paddle.

      • despawn

        public abstract void despawn()
        An abstract method that is called when the ball misses the paddle.

      • run

        public void run()
        The run method does all of the work for the object. It calls its move method with each iteration of the while loop until the despawned boolean is true.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • GameOver

        public void GameOver()
        The GameOver method is called once the while loop in the run method is finished (aka when the game is over). It closes the GameFrame window and opens the GameOverGUI where the user can save their score.

      • sleep

        public void sleep(int milli)
        The sleep method stops the process for a given amount of time.
        Parameters:
        milli - a given amount of time.

      • Paint

        public abstract void Paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        The Paint method is an abstract method which draws the object on the Frame.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics employed by the frame the object is being drawn on.

      • collisionCheck

        public java.lang.Boolean collisionCheck(base o2)
        The collisionCheck method compares the locations of the ball (this) and the paddle (o2) and returns true if they have collided.
        Parameters:
        o2 - The paddle
        Returns:
        True if the objects collided, false if not.

      • hitCheck

        public void hitCheck(base o2)
        A function that sees if collisionCheck is true and calls the deflect and bounce methods if it is true.
        Parameters:
        o2 - The paddle
